basics.name: Maxime SOARES CORREIA
basics.summary: Master’s student in Geology at the Institut de Physique du Globe de Paris (IPGP). Passionate about planetary sciences, geochemistry, petrography, and the use of artificial intelligence and programming in geosciences.

work.name: GEOPS - Géosciences Paris-Saclay
work.position: Research Assistant (with B. Saint-Bézar, A. Benedicto, and B. Brigaud)
work.summary: Developed a 3D geostatistical model of radioactivity distribution from in-situ surface measurements. Designed a workflow to extrapolate surface data in depth and implemented 3D kriging interpolation to construct continuous volumetric models.

work.name: GEOPS - Géosciences Paris-Saclay
work.position: Research Assistant (with G. Delpech and J.D. Moreau)
work.summary: 3D photogrammetric modeling of rock samples and development of a database for storage. Conducted petrographic analyses of sedimentary, volcanic, and metamorphic rocks.

work.name: GEOPS - Géosciences Paris-Saclay
work.position: Research Assistant (with F. Schmidt and L. Martinez)
work.summary: Validated a crater-counting model on the Moon using AI. Adapted an existing Faster R-CNN pipeline for automatic recognition of lunar impact craters. Wrote a report in English and gained initial research experience.

education.institution: Institut de Physique du Globe de Paris (IPGP)
courses: Volcanic, tectonic, and geophysical field studies in the Limagne Rift and Chaîne des Puys region.
Volcanological study of the Puy de Sancy, Mont-Dore Massif, and Cantal stratovolcano.
Major in Python Modeling (19/20), Programming (19.5/20), English (19/20), Quantitative Methods in Geosciences (16.8/20).
Impact crater modeling using Python and SageMath (EasyCraterSim).
Field courses in Cantal (Magmatism), Morvan (Geophysics, Hydrogeology), Cotentin (Magmatism, Metamorphism), and the Alps (Tectonics, Geomorphology).
VigieCiel Instructor with the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle (MNHN).
VigieCratère project: validating terrestrial impact structures.

education.institution: EPITA — École Pour l’Informatique et les Technologies Avancées
courses: Full English curriculum covering mathematics, physics, and electronics.
Training in OCaml, Python, JavaScript, C#, and SQL.
Developed a video game as a semester-long project.

projects.name: EasyCraterSim
projects.summary: Lightweight numerical simulation tool for impact crater formation. Developed a workflow for crater morphology analysis based on impact parameters. Open-source project intended for integration with the VigieCratère citizen science program.

projects.name: TISA – Thin-section Image Segmenter and Analyzer
projects.summary: Developed an AI pipeline for automatic quantification of carbonate grains in thin sections using FastSAM. Built upon PetroSeg by F. Azzam (2024).

projects.name: AGUPS (Geology Student Association of Université Paris-Saclay)
projects.summary: President. Organized field courses and events for students, including a 10-day geological field study in Cotentin (Normandy). Collaborated with MNHN, GEOPS, and the Earth Sciences Graduate School.

projects.name: VigieCiel – Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle
projects.summary: Instructor for meteorite recognition workshops. Designed educational kits including real meteorite samples. Funded by Université Paris-Saclay.

projects.name: Junior Space Academy – Summer School
projects.summary: One-week summer program including conferences on planetology, cosmochemistry, and space engineering. Organized by UVSQ, IPGP, Sorbonne Jussieu, IAS, Safran, and ONERA.
